Dear Pauline

 

Your Employers’ Liability policy is due for renewal on 1st January.

 

Full details of our recommendations this year are attached to this email. We suggest you read our renewal letter first, which provides an overview as to what is included and other important information concerning renewal.

 

This year we have also approached another insurer, Zurich, for terms which are also detailed in the letter.

 

We would advise you to carefully examine all documents we send, to ensure they meet with your requirements. If they are incorrect please advise us immediately.

 

Please find attached the following documentation

Please find attached the following documentation

 

-          Our Renewal Report  

-          Comparison of Covers       

 

-          AXA:-

Renewal Schedule

Policy Wording

 

-          Zurich:-

-          Quote Schedule

-          Policy Wording

 

Should you require any amendments to the current sums insured, please let me know as soon as possible so that revised terms can be obtain prior to expiry.

 

Duty of Fair Presentation

 

We take this opportunity to remind you that they owe a duty to make a fair presentation of the risk to the insurer. You have a duty to disclose to the insurer every material circumstance which you know or ought to know after a reasonable search or which is sufficient to put the insurer on notice that it needs to make further enquiries for the purpose of revealing those material circumstances. In addition, you have a duty to disclose information in a clear and accessible manner.

 

If you would like to receive a paper copy of the enclosed documents please let us know and we will send these to you.

 

I trust you will find this to be in order, however should you have any questions or queries, please do not hesitate to contact me. I await your instructions by 31st December.. 

 

Kind regards

 

 

 

Teresa Woodward, Cert CII

Broker, Global & Corporate Risks

 

D 0044 (0)121 260 1712  

 



 

8th Floor, 45 Church Street, Birmingham, B3 2RT

howdengroup.com

Duty of Fair Presentation

 

We take this opportunity to remind you that they owe a duty to make a fair presentation of the risk to the insurer. You have a duty to disclose to the insurer every material circumstance which you know or ought to know after a reasonable search or which is sufficient to put the insurer on notice that it needs to make further enquiries for the purpose of revealing those material circumstances. In addition, you have a duty to disclose information in a clear and accessible manner.

 

If you would like to receive a paper copy of the enclosed documents please let us know and we will send these to you.
